meanings.definition: A rotating coil or coils of a dynamo or electric motor.
meanings.sent1: The armature in the electric motor spins rapidly.
meanings.sent2: The armature of the dynamo generates electricity when it rotates.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the armature for a toy and tried to spin it.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like the armature of a dynamo, constantly in motion and generating new thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The armature hummed with energy as it spun around in the motor.

meanings.definition: A framework or skeleton that supports a sculpture.
meanings.sent1: The sculptor carefully crafted the armature to give shape to the clay.
meanings.sent2: The armature of the sculpture provided a sturdy base for the artist's work.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought the armature was a climbing frame and got stuck.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the armature that held her artistic dreams together.
meanings.sent5: The armature stood tall, supporting the weight of the clay figure above.

meanings.definition: A piece of soft iron connecting the poles of a magnet.
meanings.sent1: The armature enhanced the magnetic field of the magnet.
meanings.sent2: The soft iron armature helped maintain the strength of the magnet.
meanings.sent3: The curious child thought the armature was a magical wand and waved it around.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as the armature, drawing people closer with their magnetic charm.
meanings.sent5: The armature connected the poles, creating a powerful magnetic bond.
